org.sd.text.proximity
Class PowerfulTermFeature

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.text.proximity.PowerfulTermFeature
All Implemented Interfaces:
BooleanFeatureComputation
public class PowerfulTermFeature
extends java.lang.Object
implements BooleanFeatureComputation

A boolean feature computation to determine whether a powerful keyword term is found in text.

Author:
Spence Koehler

computeFeature

public java.lang.Boolean computeFeature(java.lang.String text)
Compute the boolean feature value for the text.

Specified by:
computeFeature in interface BooleanFeatureComputation
Returns:
true if keyword power meets or exceeds the minimum, false if the keyword power is lower than the minimum, or null if the text is not a keyword.

split

public SegmentSequence split(java.lang.String text)
Split the string to data into alternating sequences of consecutive powerful and non-powerful terms.

Specified by:
split in interface BooleanFeatureComputation
Returns:
the segment sequence of the split text or null if there are no powerful terms in the text.
